content.en: Neural flight control: Researchers have been exploring the use of neural networks, a type of artificial intelligence, for various aspects of flight control. These algorithms have been employed for tasks such as stabilization, tracking, adaptive control, and even the synthesis of flight control algorithms. By utilizing neural networks, scientists aim to improve the performance and autonomy of aircraft, including unmanned systems. However, challenges such as stability, convergence, and verification and validation still need to be addressed in order to fully harness the potential of these algorithms in flight control systems.
content.da: Neural flyvekontrol: Forskere har undersøgt brugen af neurale netværk, en type kunstig intelligens, til forskellige aspekter af flyvekontrol. Disse algoritmer er blevet anvendt til opgaver som stabilisering, sporing, adaptiv kontrol og endda syntese af flyvekontrolalgoritmer. Ved at bruge neurale netværk sigter forskere på at forbedre ydeevnen og autonomien af fly, inklusive ubemandede systemer. Dog skal udfordringer som stabilitet, konvergens og verifikation og validering stadig adresseres for fuldt ud at udnytte potentialet af disse algoritmer i flyvekontrolsystemer.
